alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:43AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGHER SURF ALONG BRISTOL BAY AND KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST MONDAY... A unseasonably strong low is expected to track through the eastern Bering Sea Sunday night. Strong winds will develop as it moves towards the coastal areas along Bristol Bay and as far north as the Kuskokwim Delta after midnight through Monday morning. Winds are expected to shift southwesterly and increase to 30 to 40 kt. Sustained high winds Monday morning raises concerns for possible high surf for Bristol Bay and the Kuskokwim Delta, but flooding looks to be less likely at this time. However, there is some uncertainty on how high the storm surge will actually be. Additionally, strong sustained winds will lead to higher seas, potentially building up to 8 to 12 feet south of Cape Newenham and Bristol Bay. Winds and seas should subside Monday night. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc.
